H0.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Mathematician

H1.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Physicist

H2.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Astronomer

H3.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Chemist

A4.text: Sir Isaac Newton was an English polymath who was a mathematician, physicist, astronomer, alchemist, theologian, author and inventor.

A5.text: In the Principia, Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation that formed the dominant scientific viewpoint for centuries.

A6.text: Newton had already developed calculus by the time he wrote the Principia.

A7.text: Newton combined knowledge of celestial motions with the study of events on Earth and showed that one theory of mechanics could encompass both.

A8.text: Newton's Laws of Dynamics are part of The Feynman Lectures on Physics.
